page.title: 03Farming-Treveor Farm
page.content: Treveor is Cornish for'great dwelling' and was once the home of Sir Henry Treveor.There is a farmhouse and 6 cottages.It is a diary farm of 234 acres.There are 146 milking cows, 45 heifer calves and a bull-all are Friesians.The rotary milking parlour takes 20 cows at a time and 700 gallons of milk are produced every day Besides the farmer,two herdsmen a tractor driver and a milkman also work there.The farm grows enough to feed its animals-grass for grazing and cut grass is stored in a high tower-it takes 850 tons haylage(something between hay and silage)Barley is grown on 13 acres not needed of grass.There is also 3 acre campsite taking 50 visitors each Summer.Visitors can also enjoy the farm and nearby beachs.
